resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: Possible race condition in JHS if the job is not loaded

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
This is the race condition that can occur:

# during the first *scanIntermediateDirectory()*, *HistoryFileInfo.moveToDone()* is scheduled for job j1
# during the second *scanIntermediateDirectory()*, j1 is found again and put in the *fileStatusList* to process
# *HistoryFileInfo.moveToDone()* is processed in another thread and history files are moved to the finished directory
# the *HistoryFileInfo* for j1 is removed from *jobListCache*
# the j1 in *fileStatusList* is processed and a new *HistoryFileInfo* for j1 is created (history, conf, and summary files will point to the intermediate user directory, and state will be IN_INTERMEDIATE) and added to the *jobListCache*
# *moveToDone()* is scheduled for this new j1
# *moveToDone()* fails during *moveToDoneNow()* for the history file because the source path in the intermediate directory does not exist

From this point on, while the new j1 *HistoryFileInfo* is in the *jobListCache*, the JobHistoryServer will think the history file is in the intermediate directory. If a user queries this job in the JobHistoryServer UI, they will get

{code}
org.apache.hadoop.yarn.exceptions.YarnRuntimeException: Could not load history file <scheme>://<host>:<port>/mr-history/intermediate/<user>/job_1529348381246_27275711-1535123223269-<user>-<jobname>-1535127026668-1-0-SUCCEEDED-<queue>-1535126980787.jhist
{code}

Noticed this issue while running 2.7.4, but the race condition seems to still exist in trunk.
fields.summary: Job History Server has race condition where it moves files from intermediate to finished but thinks file is in intermediate

comments.body: [~erwaman], added you to the list of contributors and assigned the JIRA to you
Hi guys, I made some threading-related changes (ironically, to mitigate a race) in JHS back in January: MAPREDUCE-7015. Could that be related?
[~pbacsko], we are seeing the issue in 2.7.4, and MAPREDUCE-7015 is only as far back as 2.10, so it should not be the cause.

Attached a patch that fixes this issue: [^MAPREDUCE-7131.1.patch]. [~jlowe], [~pbacsko], [~varun_saxena], could you help review?

My approach is basically to have *moveToDoneNow()* handle the case where the move has already happened by ignoring the FileNotFoundException.

Hmm, will investigate why the unit test I added fails during the Jenkins build but not locally.

-+1 LGTM (non-binding) from me.-

Let's wait until the test is fixed.

I found that the new testcase fails on my machine too.

{{Assert.assertFalse(info.isMovePending());}} --> this is the offending assertion.

[~erwaman] if you can't reproduce it, I can send you logs or debug info if you need it.
[~pbacsko], thanks for trying out the new testcase locally. Let me try to debug this a little bit more; if I still can't figure it out, I'll sync up with you.
Ah, looks like this is a TimeZone issue. My test uses a time that returns different dates in Pacific vs. UTC time. Will fix soon.
Uploaded a [new patch|^MAPREDUCE-7131.3.patch] which fixes the TimeZone issues by specifying UTC for the test.

OK, now it passed on my machine also.

So +1 non-binding.

Thanks for the report and patch!

Are the timezone changes in the code really necessary?  They only appear to be necessary because the unit test is hardcoding a UTC date in the paths rather than computing it based on the current timezone.  I think the unit test can call JobHistoryUtils.timestampDirectoryComponent to help compute the done directory path.  That would preclude the JobHistoryUtils changes and the need to override canonicalHistoryLogPath in the unit test.

Hi [~jlowe],

Thanks for the review. Good point – I could have the test calculate the time zone based on the default locale. Will update my patch to do that.
Uploaded [new patch|^MAPREDUCE-7131.5.patch] addressing [~jlowe]'s feedback.
